neighbors.name: Braden B H & Son Limited Partnership
neighbors.claims: The entity has received agricultural subsidies from the USDA ([EWG](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=13115&progcode=total_dp&regionname=FloydCounty,Georgia)). A portion of the Braden Farm property associated with the family partnership was sold to the Rome-Floyd County Development Authority to establish 'Enterprise Corner,' a new industrial park along Highway 411 ([Floyd County Finance](https://www.floydcountyga.gov/sites/default/files/fileattachments/finance/page/18064/2021_acfr_final.092622.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Significant land holdings; history of supplying land for industrial development

approach_recommendations.engage: Acknowledge the partnership's role in enabling local economic growth through the Enterprise Corner transaction. Discuss how this project aligns with the industrial corridor established by previous family land sales.

citations.claim: The entity has received agricultural subsidies from the USDA
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidies: Floyd County, GA

citations.claim: Part of the Braden Farm was sold to the Rome-Floyd County Development Authority for an industrial park
citations.title: Floyd County 2021 Annual Comprehensive Financial Report

neighbors.name: Norma S. Braden
neighbors.claims: Norma S. Braden (1931–2026) was a longtime Rome resident and a founding member of Woodlawn Baptist Church ([Henderson & Sons](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Norma-Sheffield-Braden?obId=46889793)). She served as President of the Spade and Trowel Garden Club and the Rome Christian Women’s Club ([Henderson & Sons](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Norma-Sheffield-Braden?obId=46889793)). She was the widow of Biddy Hill Braden, who served on the Rome-Floyd County Industrial Development Commission ([Henderson & Sons](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Biddy-Hill-Braden?obId=32563810)). She passed away on January 8, 2026 ([Henderson & Sons](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Norma-Sheffield-Braden?obId=46889793)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Deceased; historical leadership in local civic clubs

approach_recommendations.engage: Address the estate executors or heirs. Acknowledge the Braden family's long history of civic service and leadership in Floyd County when discussing the property.

citations.claim: Founding member of Woodlawn Baptist Church and President of Spade and Trowel Garden Club
citations.title: Obituary: Norma Sheffield Braden

citations.claim: Widow of Biddy Hill Braden who served on Rome-Floyd County Industrial Development Commission
citations.title: Obituary: Biddy Hill Braden

neighbors.name: Mark H. Braden
neighbors.claims: Mark H. Braden resides in Rome, Georgia, and is the son of the late Biddy and Norma S. Braden ([Henderson & Sons](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Norma-Sheffield-Braden?obId=46889793)). He is an alumnus of the Darlington School ([Darlington School](https://issuu.com/darlingtonschool/docs/darlington_magazine_fall_2025)). In 2021, the Rome-Floyd County Development Authority purchased part of the 'Braden Farm' on Highway 411 to develop the 'Enterprise Corner' industrial park ([Floyd County Finance](https://www.floydcountyga.gov/sites/default/files/fileattachments/finance/page/18064/2021_acfr_final.092622.pdf)). His father, Biddy Braden, previously served on the Rome-Floyd County Industrial Development Commission ([Henderson & Sons](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Biddy-Hill-Braden?obId=32563810)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Family sold land for industrial park; longstanding local ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage the family's established relationship with the Rome-Floyd County Development Authority. Emphasize how the project aligns with the economic progress facilitated by the family's previous sale of land for Enterprise Corner.

neighbors.verification_notes: Distinguished from DC-based attorney Mark Braden (BakerHostetler) who works in redistricting; this Mark Braden is a local resident/heir engaged in agriculture/land management.

citations.claim: Son of the late Biddy and Norma S. Braden
citations.title: Obituary: Norma Sheffield Braden
